member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent
member.summary: An async-compatible auto-reset event.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent._queue
member.summary: The queue of TCSs that other tasks are awaiting.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent._set
member.summary: The current state of the event.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent._id
member.summary: The semi-unique identifier for this instance. This is 0 if the id has not yet been created.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent._mutex
member.summary: The object used for mutual exclusion.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent.#ctor(System.Boolean,Nito.AsyncEx.IAsyncWaitQueue{System.Object})
member.summary: Creates an async-compatible auto-reset event.
member.param: Whether the auto-reset event is initially set or unset.
The wait queue used to manage waiters. This may be null to use a default (FIFO) queue.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an async-compatible auto-reset event.
member.param: Whether the auto-reset event is initially set or unset.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an async-compatible auto-reset event that is initially unset.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent.Id
member.summary: Gets a semi-unique identifier for this asynchronous auto-reset event.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent.IsSet
member.summary: Whether this event is currently set. This member is seldom used; code using this member has a high possibility of race conditions.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent.WaitAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously waits for this event to be set. If the event is set, this method will auto-reset it and return immediately, even if the cancellation token is already signalled. If the wait is canceled, then it will not auto-reset this event.
member.param: The cancellation token used to cancel this wait.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent.WaitAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously waits for this event to be set. If the event is set, this method will auto-reset it and return immediately.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent.Wait(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Synchronously waits for this event to be set. If the event is set, this method will auto-reset it and return immediately, even if the cancellation token is already signalled. If the wait is canceled, then it will not auto-reset this event. This method may block the calling thread.
member.param: The cancellation token used to cancel this wait.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent.Wait
member.summary: Synchronously waits for this event to be set. If the event is set, this method will auto-reset it and return immediately. This method may block the calling thread.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncAutoResetEvent.Set
member.summary: Sets the event, atomically completing a task returned by . If the event is already set, this method does nothing.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable
member.summary: An async-compatible condition variable. This type uses Mesa-style semantics (the notifying tasks do not yield).

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable._asyncLock
member.summary: The lock associated with this condition variable.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable._queue
member.summary: The queue of waiting tasks.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable._id
member.summary: The semi-unique identifier for this instance. This is 0 if the id has not yet been created.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable._mutex
member.summary: The object used for mutual exclusion.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable.#ctor(Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLock,Nito.AsyncEx.IAsyncWaitQueue{System.Object})
member.summary: Creates an async-compatible condition variable associated with an async-compatible lock.
member.param: The lock associated with this condition variable.
The wait queue used to manage waiters. This may be null to use a default (FIFO) queue.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable.#ctor(Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLock)
member.summary: Creates an async-compatible condition variable associated with an async-compatible lock.
member.param: The lock associated with this condition variable.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable.Id
member.summary: Gets a semi-unique identifier for this asynchronous condition variable.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable.Notify
member.summary: Sends a signal to a single task waiting on this condition variable. The associated lock MUST be held when calling this method, and it will still be held when this method returns.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable.NotifyAll
member.summary: Sends a signal to all tasks waiting on this condition variable. The associated lock MUST be held when calling this method, and it will still be held when this method returns.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable.WaitAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously waits for a signal on this condition variable. The associated lock MUST be held when calling this method, and it will still be held when this method returns, even if the method is cancelled.
member.param: The cancellation signal used to cancel this wait.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable.WaitAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously waits for a signal on this condition variable. The associated lock MUST be held when calling this method, and it will still be held when the returned task completes.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable.Wait(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Synchronously waits for a signal on this condition variable. This method may block the calling thread. The associated lock MUST be held when calling this method, and it will still be held when this method returns, even if the method is cancelled.
member.param: The cancellation signal used to cancel this wait.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncConditionVariable.Wait
member.summary: Synchronously waits for a signal on this condition variable. This method may block the calling thread. The associated lock MUST be held when calling this method, and it will still be held when this method returns.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent
member.summary: An async-compatible countdown event.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent._mre
member.summary: The underlying manual-reset event.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent._count
member.summary: The remaining count on this event.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates an async-compatible countdown event.
member.param: The number of signals this event will need before it becomes set.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent.Id
member.summary: Gets a semi-unique identifier for this asynchronous countdown event.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent.CurrentCount
member.summary: Gets the current number of remaining signals before this event becomes set. This member is seldom used; code using this member has a high possibility of race conditions.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent.WaitAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously waits for the count to reach zero.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent.WaitAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Synchronously waits for the count to reach zero. This method may block the calling thread.
member.param: The cancellation token used to cancel the wait. If this token is already canceled, this method will first check whether the event is set.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent.Wait
member.summary: Synchronously waits for the count to reach zero. This method may block the calling thread.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent.Wait(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Synchronously waits for the count to reach zero. This method may block the calling thread.
member.param: The cancellation token used to cancel the wait. If this token is already canceled, this method will first check whether the event is set.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent.ModifyCount(System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attempts to modify the current count by the specified amount.
member.param: The amount to change the current count.
true to add to the current count; false to subtract.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent.AddCount(System.Int64)
member.summary: Adds the specified value to the current count.
member.param: The amount to change the current count.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent.AddCount
member.summary: Adds one to the current count.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent.Signal(System.Int64)
member.summary: Subtracts the specified value from the current count.
member.param: The amount to change the current count.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCountdownEvent.Signal
member.summary: Subtracts one from the current count.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazyFlags
member.summary: Flags controlling the behavior of .

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazyFlags.None
member.summary: No special flags. The factory method is executed on a thread pool thread, and does not retry initialization on failures (failures are cached).

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazyFlags.ExecuteOnCallingThread
member.summary: Execute the factory method on the calling thread.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazyFlags.RetryOnFailure
member.summary: If the factory method fails, then re-run the factory method the next time instead of caching the failed task.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazy`1
member.summary: Provides support for asynchronous lazy initialization. This type is fully threadsafe.
member.typeparam: The type of object that is being asynchronously initialized.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazy`1._mutex
member.summary: The synchronization object protecting _instance.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazy`1._factory
member.summary: The factory method to call.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazy`1._instance
member.summary: The underlying lazy task.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazy`1._id
member.summary: The semi-unique identifier for this instance. This is 0 if the id has not yet been created.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazy`1.#ctor(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task{`0}},Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazyFlags)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The asynchronous delegate that is invoked to produce the value when it is needed. May not be null.
Flags to influence async lazy semantics.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazy`1.Id
member.summary: Gets a semi-unique identifier for this asynchronous lazy instance.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazy`1.IsStarted
member.summary: Whether the asynchronous factory method has started. This is initially false and becomes true when this instance is awaited or after is called.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazy`1.Task
member.summary: Starts the asynchronous factory method, if it has not already started, and returns the resulting task.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazy`1.GetAwaiter
member.summary: Asynchronous infrastructure support. This method permits instances of to be await'ed.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazy`1.ConfigureAwait(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Asynchronous infrastructure support. This method permits instances of to be await'ed.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLazy`1.Start
member.summary: Starts the asynchronous initialization, if it has not already started.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLock
member.summary: A mutual exclusion lock that is compatible with async. Note that this lock is not recursive!

member.summary: Whether the lock is taken by a task.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLock._queue
member.summary: The queue of TCSs that other tasks are awaiting to acquire the lock.

member.summary: The semi-unique identifier for this instance. This is 0 if the id has not yet been created.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLock._mutex
member.summary: The object used for mutual exclusion.

member.summary: Creates a new async-compatible mutual exclusion lock.

member.summary: Creates a new async-compatible mutual exclusion lock using the specified wait queue.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLock.Id
member.summary: Gets a semi-unique identifier for this asynchronous lock.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLock.RequestLockAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously acquires the lock. Returns a disposable that releases the lock when disposed.
member.param: The cancellation token used to cancel the lock. If this is already set, then this method will attempt to take the lock immediately (succeeding if the lock is currently available).
member.returns: A disposable that releases the lock when disposed.

member.summary: Asynchronously acquires the lock. Returns a disposable that releases the lock when disposed.
member.param: The cancellation token used to cancel the lock. If this is already set, then this method will attempt to take the lock immediately (succeeding if the lock is currently available).
member.returns: A disposable that releases the lock when disposed.

member.summary: Asynchronously acquires the lock. Returns a disposable that releases the lock when disposed.
member.returns: A disposable that releases the lock when disposed.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLock.Lock(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Synchronously acquires the lock. Returns a disposable that releases the lock when disposed. This method may block the calling thread.
member.param: The cancellation token used to cancel the lock. If this is already set, then this method will attempt to take the lock immediately (succeeding if the lock is currently available).

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLock.Lock
member.summary: Synchronously acquires the lock. Returns a disposable that releases the lock when disposed. This method may block the calling thread.

member.summary: Releases the lock.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncLock.Key
member.summary: The disposable which releases the lock.

member.summary: Creates the key for a lock.

member.summary: Asynchronously waits for this event to be set.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncManualResetEvent.Set
member.summary: Sets the event, atomically completing every task returned by . If the event is already set, this method does nothing.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncManualResetEvent.Reset
member.summary: Resets the event. If the event is already reset, this method does nothing.

member.summary: Asynchronously enters the monitor. Returns a disposable that leaves the monitor when disposed.

member.summary: Asynchronously enters the monitor. Returns a disposable that leaves the monitor when disposed.

member.summary: Synchronously enters the monitor. Returns a disposable that leaves the monitor when disposed. This method may block the calling thread.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncMonitor.Enter
member.summary: Asynchronously enters the monitor. Returns a disposable that leaves the monitor when disposed. This method may block the calling thread.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncMonitor.WaitAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously waits for a pulse signal on this monitor. The monitor MUST already be entered when calling this method, and it will still be entered when this method returns, even if the method is cancelled. This method internally will leave the monitor while waiting for a notification.
member.param: The cancellation signal used to cancel this wait.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncMonitor.WaitAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously waits for a pulse signal on this monitor. The monitor MUST already be entered when calling this method, and it will still be entered when this method returns. This method internally will leave the monitor while waiting for a notification.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncMonitor.Wait(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously waits for a pulse signal on this monitor. This method may block the calling thread. The monitor MUST already be entered when calling this method, and it will still be entered when this method returns, even if the method is cancelled. This method internally will leave the monitor while waiting for a notification.
member.param: The cancellation signal used to cancel this wait.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncMonitor.Wait
member.summary: Asynchronously waits for a pulse signal on this monitor. This method may block the calling thread. The monitor MUST already be entered when calling this method, and it will still be entered when this method returns. This method internally will leave the monitor while waiting for a notification.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncMonitor.Pulse
member.summary: Sends a signal to a single task waiting on this monitor. The monitor MUST already be entered when calling this method, and it will still be entered when this method returns.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncMonitor.PulseAll
member.summary: Sends a signal to all tasks waiting on this monitor. The monitor MUST already be entered when calling this method, and it will still be entered when this method returns.

member.summary: The maximum number of elements allowed in the queue.

member.summary: The mutual-exclusion lock protecting _queue and _completed.

member.summary: A condition variable that is signalled when the queue is completed or not empty.

member.summary: Whether this producer/consumer queue has been marked complete for adding.

member.summary: Creates a new async-compatible producer/consumer queue with a maximum element count.
member.param: The maximum element count. This must be greater than zero.

member.summary: Creates a new async-compatible producer/consumer queue.

member.summary: Whether the queue is empty. This property assumes that the _mutex is already held.

A cancellation token that can be used to abort the enqueue operation.

member.exception: The producer/consumer queue has been marked complete for adding.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncProducerConsumerQueue`1.OutputAvailableAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)

member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to abort the asynchronous wait.

member.summary: Asynchronously waits until an item is available to dequeue. Returns false if the producer/consumer queue has completed adding and there are no more items.

member.summary: Synchronously waits until an item is available to dequeue. Returns false if the producer/consumer queue has completed adding and there are no more items.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to abort the asynchronous wait.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncProducerConsumerQueue`1.OutputAvailable
member.summary: Synchronously waits until an item is available to dequeue. Returns false if the producer/consumer queue has completed adding and there are no more items.

member.summary: Provides a (synchronous) consuming enumerable for items in the producer/consumer queue.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncProducerConsumerQueue`1.DoDequeueAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dequeues an item from the producer/consumer queue. Throws if the producer/consumer queue has completed adding and is empty.

member.exception: The producer/consumer queue has been marked complete for adding and is empty.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncProducerConsumerQueue`1.DequeueAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)

member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to abort the dequeue operation.
member.returns: The dequeued item.
member.exception: The producer/consumer queue has been marked complete for adding and is empty.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncProducerConsumerQueue`1.DequeueAsync
member.summary: Dequeues an item from the producer/consumer queue. Returns the dequeued item. Throws if the producer/consumer queue has completed adding and is empty.
member.returns: The dequeued item.
member.exception: The producer/consumer queue has been marked complete for adding and is empty.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncProducerConsumerQueue`1.Dequeue(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Dequeues an item from the producer/consumer queue. Returns the dequeued item. This method may block the calling thread. Throws if the producer/consumer queue has completed adding and is empty.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to abort the dequeue operation.
member.returns: The dequeued item.
member.exception: The producer/consumer queue has been marked complete for adding and is empty.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncProducerConsumerQueue`1.Dequeue
member.summary: Dequeues an item from the producer/consumer queue. Returns the dequeued item. This method may block the calling thread. Throws if the producer/consumer queue has completed adding and is empty.
member.returns: The dequeued item.
member.exception: The producer/consumer queue has been marked complete for adding and is empty.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncReaderWriterLock
member.summary: A reader/writer lock that is compatible with async. Note that this lock is not recursive!

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncReaderWriterLock._writerQueue
member.summary: The queue of TCSs that other tasks are awaiting to acquire the lock as writers.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncReaderWriterLock._readerQueue
member.summary: The queue of TCSs that other tasks are awaiting to acquire the lock as readers.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncReaderWriterLock._mutex
member.summary: The object used for mutual exclusion.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncReaderWriterLock._id
member.summary: The semi-unique identifier for this instance. This is 0 if the id has not yet been created.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncReaderWriterLock._locksHeld
member.summary: Number of reader locks held; -1 if a writer lock is held; 0 if no locks are held.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncReaderWriterLock.#ctor(Nito.AsyncEx.IAsyncWaitQueue{System.IDisposable},Nito.AsyncEx.IAsyncWaitQueue{System.IDisposable})
member.summary: Creates a new async-compatible reader/writer lock.
member.param: The wait queue used to manage waiters for writer locks. This may be null to use a default (FIFO) queue.
The wait queue used to manage waiters for reader locks. This may be null to use a default (FIFO) queue.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncReaderWriterLock.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new async-compatible reader/writer lock.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncReaderWriterLock.Id
member.summary: Gets a semi-unique identifier for this asynchronous lock.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncReaderWriterLock.ReleaseWaitersWhenCanceled(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Applies a continuation to the task that will call if the task is canceled. This method may not be called while holding the sync lock.
member.param: The task to observe for cancellation.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncReaderWriterLock.RequestReaderLockAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously acquires the lock as a reader. Returns a disposable that releases the lock when disposed.
member.param: The cancellation token used to cancel the lock. If this is already set, then this method will attempt to take the lock immediately (succeeding if the lock is currently available).
member.returns: A disposable that releases the lock when disposed.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncReaderWriterLock.ReaderLockAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously acquires the lock as a reader. Returns a disposable that releases the lock when disposed.
member.param: The cancellation token used to cancel the lock. If this is already set, then this method will attempt to take the lock immediately (succeeding if the lock is currently available).
member.returns: A disposable that releases the lock when disposed.

member.summary: Asynchronously acquires the lock as a reader. Returns a disposable that releases the lock when disposed.
member.returns: A disposable that releases the lock when disposed.

member.param: The cancellation token used to cancel the lock. If this is already set, then this method will attempt to take the lock immediately (succeeding if the lock is currently available).

member.summary: An async-compatible semaphore. Alternatively, you could use SemaphoreSlim.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore._queue
member.summary: The queue of TCSs that other tasks are awaiting to acquire the semaphore.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore._count
member.summary: The number of waits that will be immediately granted.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore._id
member.summary: The semi-unique identifier for this instance. This is 0 if the id has not yet been created.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore._mutex
member.summary: The object used for mutual exclusion.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore.#ctor(System.Int64,Nito.AsyncEx.IAsyncWaitQueue{System.Object})
member.summary: Creates a new async-compatible semaphore with the specified initial count.
member.param: The initial count for this semaphore. This must be greater than or equal to zero.
The wait queue used to manage waiters. This may be null to use a default (FIFO) queue.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates a new async-compatible semaphore with the specified initial count.
member.param: The initial count for this semaphore. This must be greater than or equal to zero.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore.Id
member.summary: Gets a semi-unique identifier for this asynchronous semaphore.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore.CurrentCount
member.summary: Gets the number of slots currently available on this semaphore. This member is seldom used; code using this member has a high possibility of race conditions.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore.WaitAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously waits for a slot in the semaphore to be available.
member.param: The cancellation token used to cancel the wait. If this is already set, then this method will attempt to take the slot immediately (succeeding if a slot is currently available).

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore.WaitAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously waits for a slot in the semaphore to be available.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore.Wait(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Synchronously waits for a slot in the semaphore to be available. This method may block the calling thread.
member.param: The cancellation token used to cancel the wait. If this is already set, then this method will attempt to take the slot immediately (succeeding if a slot is currently available).

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore.Wait
member.summary: Synchronously waits for a slot in the semaphore to be available. This method may block the calling thread.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore.Release(System.Int64)
member.summary: Releases the semaphore.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncSemaphore.Release
member.summary: Releases the semaphore.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.IAsyncWaitQueue`1
member.summary: A collection of cancelable instances. Implementations must assume the caller is holding a lock.
member.typeparam: The type of the results. If this isn't needed, use .

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.IAsyncWaitQueue`1.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets whether the queue is empty.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.IAsyncWaitQueue`1.Enqueue
member.summary: Creates a new entry and queues it to this wait queue. The returned task must support both synchronous and asynchronous waits.
member.returns: The queued task.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.IAsyncWaitQueue`1.Dequeue(`0)
member.summary: Removes a single entry in the wait queue and completes it. This method may only be called if is false. The task continuations for the completed task must be executed asynchronously.
member.param: The result used to complete the wait queue entry. If this isn't needed, use default(T).

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.IAsyncWaitQueue`1.DequeueAll(`0)
member.summary: Removes all entries in the wait queue and completes them. The task continuations for the completed tasks must be executed asynchronously.
member.param: The result used to complete the wait queue entries. If this isn't needed, use default(T).

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.IAsyncWaitQueue`1.TryCancel(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Attempts to remove an entry from the wait queue and cancels it. The task continuations for the completed task must be executed asynchronously.
member.param: The task to cancel.
The cancellation token to use to cancel the task.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.IAsyncWaitQueue`1.CancelAll(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Removes all entries from the wait queue and cancels them. The task continuations for the completed tasks must be executed asynchronously.
member.param: The cancellation token to use to cancel the tasks.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncWaitQueueExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for wait queues.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncWaitQueueExtensions.Enqueue``1(Nito.AsyncEx.IAsyncWaitQueue{``0},System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a new entry and queues it to this wait queue. If the cancellation token is already canceled, this method immediately returns a canceled task without modifying the wait queue.
member.param: The wait queue.
A synchronization object taken while cancelling the entry.
The token used to cancel the wait.
member.returns: The queued task.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.DefaultAsyncWaitQueue`1
member.summary: The default wait queue implementation, which uses a double-ended queue.
member.typeparam: The type of the results. If this isn't needed, use .

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.AwaitableDisposable`1
member.summary: An awaitable wrapper around a task whose result is disposable. The wrapper is not disposable, so this prevents usage errors like "using (MyAsync())" when the appropriate usage should be "using (await MyAsync())".
member.typeparam: The type of the result of the underlying task.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AwaitableDisposable`1._task
member.summary: The underlying task.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AwaitableDisposable`1.#ctor(System.Threading.Tasks.Task{`0})
member.summary: Initializes a new awaitable wrapper around the specified task.
member.param: The underlying task to wrap. This may not be null.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AwaitableDisposable`1.AsTask
member.summary: Returns the underlying task.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AwaitableDisposable`1.op_Implicit(Nito.AsyncEx.AwaitableDisposable{`0})~System.Threading.Tasks.Task{`0}
member.summary: Implicit conversion to the underlying task.
member.param: The awaitable wrapper.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AwaitableDisposable`1.GetAwaiter
member.summary: Infrastructure. Returns the task awaiter for the underlying task.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AwaitableDisposable`1.ConfigureAwait(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Infrastructure. Returns a configured task awaiter for the underlying task.
member.param: Whether to attempt to marshal the continuation back to the captured context.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.IdManager`1
member.summary: Allocates Ids for instances on demand. 0 is an invalid/unassigned Id. Ids may be non-unique in very long-running systems. This is similar to the Id system used by and .
member.typeparam: The type for which ids are generated.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.IdManager`1._lastId
member.summary: The last id generated for this type. This is 0 if no ids have been generated.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.IdManager`1.GetId(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the id, allocating it if necessary.
member.param: A reference to the field containing the id.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.PauseTokenSource
member.summary: The source (controller) of a "pause token", which can be used to cooperatively pause and unpause operations.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.PauseTokenSource._mre
member.summary: The MRE that manages the "pause" logic. When the MRE is set, the token is not paused; when the MRE is not set, the token is paused.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.PauseTokenSource.IsPaused
member.summary: Whether or not this source (and its tokens) are in the paused state. This member is seldom used; code using this member has a high possibility of race conditions.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.PauseTokenSource.Token
member.summary: Gets a pause token controlled by this source.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.PauseToken
member.summary: A type that allows an operation to be cooperatively paused.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.PauseToken._mre
member.summary: The MRE that manages the "pause" logic, or null if this token can never be paused. When the MRE is set, the token is not paused; when the MRE is not set, the token is paused.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.PauseToken.CanBePaused
member.summary: Whether this token can ever possibly be paused.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.PauseToken.IsPaused
member.summary: Whether or not this token is in the paused state.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.PauseToken.WaitWhilePausedAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously waits until the pause token is not paused.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.PauseToken.WaitWhilePausedAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously waits until the pause token is not paused, or until this wait is canceled by the cancellation token.
member.param: The cancellation token to observe. If the token is already canceled, this method will first check if the pause token is unpaused, and will return without an exception in that case.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.PauseToken.WaitWhilePaused
member.summary: Synchronously waits until the pause token is not paused.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.PauseToken.WaitWhilePaused(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Synchronously waits until the pause token is not paused, or until this wait is canceled by the cancellation token.
member.param: The cancellation token to observe. If the token is already canceled, this method will first check if the pause token is unpaused, and will return without an exception in that case.
